channel.title: Compiling help please!
channel.description:
Please help!! Can you give me a link to the EXACT java i need to compile? Please, I wanna change lots of stuff. Please!!!!! :confused: :( :( :( ;) :D
[b]EDIT:[/b]
incase this might help, the server's source is: Googlescape V1.5

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @usualpker usualpker
item.description:
@usualpker wrote:

[quote=“Varmisher5150, post:14, topic:238520”]ok this is where it needs to be downloaded

  1. go to start
  2. go to my computer
  3. look for Local Disk (C:) (Local Disk can be renamed for something else depends on your computer)
  4. Look for program files and open it
  5. In program files is where it needs to be downloaded[/quote]thanks ill try this too[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 23, 2008, 02:09:12 pm[/size][hr]ok look,heres what i put in for environment variables:
    variable name: CLASSPATH
    variable value: [codebox]CLASSPATH=C:\ProgramFiles\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/codebox]

variable name: PATH
variable value: [codebox]C:\ProgramFiles\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin[/codebox]

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @usualpker usualpker
item.description:
@usualpker wrote:

[quote=“xstrxpurez, post:13, topic:238520”]c:/ drive has a file named program files… if u have not set environmental variables then u need to do so… go to the tut section and look under how to make a server and then go to the environmental variables part to do it… change the 6_06 to ur version.[/quote]ok thanks alot! ill try it

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

ok this is where it needs to be downloaded

  1. go to start
  2. go to my computer
  3. look for Local Disk (C:) (Local Disk can be renamed for something else depends on your computer)
  4. Look for program files and open it
  5. In program files is where it needs to be downloaded

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

c:/ drive has a file named program files… if u have not set environmental variables then u need to do so… go to the tut section and look under how to make a server and then go to the environmental variables part to do it… change the 6_06 to ur version.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @usualpker usualpker
item.description:
@usualpker wrote:

[quote=“Varmisher5150, post:11, topic:238520”]you need to have your java installed into your program files for it to work. you probably have it installed somewhere else[/quote]ok well i just installed version 7 and installed it to my server (Googlescape Client) what you mean program files?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

you need to have your java installed into your program files for it to work. you probably have it installed somewhere else

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @usualpker usualpker
item.description:
@usualpker wrote:

[quote=“Varmisher5150, post:9, topic:238520”]good luck :D[/quote]ty[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 23, 2008, 01:52:52 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Varmisher5150, post:7, topic:238520”]i dont need admin dude

go to that website and once u get there you will see a big button that says FREE JAVA DOWNLOAD

download it

then go to your compiler and delete everything and put in this:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

im sure it will work[/quote]when i tried downloading, it said i already had. when i copied and pasted your code, it still said “you do not have java installed. please download it at the site thats is about to come,” or something like that. Please help!!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150

@Varmisher5150 wrote:

good luck

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

im sure it will work[/quote]OK TYVM IM GONNA TRY NOW:)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 23, 2008, 01:46:29 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Rog3r, post:6, topic:238520”][quote]2) We will not help with computer problems, ie: portforwarding, how to set up java and such. Use google or our Tutorial Section.[/quote]

I don’t make the rules…[/quote]ok soz

item.title: Compiling help please!
item.dc:creator: @Varmisher5150 Varmisher5150
item.description:
@Varmisher5150 wrote:

i dont need admin dude

go to that website and once u get there you will see a big button that says FREE JAVA DOWNLOAD

download it

then go to your compiler and delete everything and put in this:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

im sure it will work
